page.title: 08Gristhorpe Village.
page.content: The village is served by doctors in Filey and there is a prescription service by voluntary collectors from the village.Because there is not an appointment system patients find it both time consuming and inconvenient to visit the doctors. The new by-pass has taken away from the village many of the buses which used to go through it.Elderly residents particularly find it difficult as they have to walk further and there is no shelter. There is a village hall which is available to residents for functions and events.It is used by the W.I.,the Youth Club and for various parties and brownie and cub 'camps'. The cricket club supports a 1st and 2nd team,the ground being 'lent' by Mr.Alfred Hood of Town Farm.
